thread.title: Fournette donates jersey to flood relief; NCAA approves

title: Fournette donates jersey to flood relief; NCAA approves
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Fournette donates jersey to flood relief; NCAA approves BATON ROUGE, La. - Though compared to his other games this year, Leonard Fournette's 158 yards rushing on 20 carries wasn't as awe-inspiring, save Post to Facebook Fournette donates jersey to flood relief; NCAA approves BATON ROUGE, La. - Though compared to his other games this year, Leonard Fournette's 158 yards rushing on 20 carries wasn't as awe-inspiring, save  //on.wwltv.com/1LoGV36   Fournette donates jersey to flood relief; NCAA approves WWLTV.com 9:28 p.m. CDT October 10, 2015 at Tiger Stadium on October 10, 2015 in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. (Photo: Stacy Revere) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BATON ROUGE, La. - Though compared to his other games this year, Leonard Fournette's 158 yards rushing on 20 carries wasn't as awe-inspiring, save for his 87-yard touchdown romp, his legend grew even larger Saturday by a simple yet poignant gesture. 
The man who seems ready for the NFL right now, who has inspired debates over whether he should challenge the rule that seeks to keep him from making his eventual fortune for another 20 months or so, got the NCAA to bend. 
Fournette knows a thing or two about surviving a historic flood, having spent days on I-10 as a young child in New Orleans. 
Fournette offered to give up his game jersey for auction, pending NCAA approval - and he got it. Just how much money the Heisman favorite can get for his jersey isn't nearly as important as the fact that he cared enough to make the gesture. Fournette is already talented and wise beyond his years. Leonard Fournette to auction jersey to benefit to flood victims. Story » http://t.co/5SY8YkzitZ pic.twitter.com/bS0U4mfgho — ESPN CollegeFootball (@ESPNCFB) October 11, 2015 The NCAA will allow Leonard Fournette to auction his jersey to raise funds for South Carolina flood victims. http://t.co/XAzbP3vtDe
